> >>>
> >>> "This DecideRule applie=
s the configured decision to any URI that is in one of the hosts of the con=
figured set."
> >>>

> >>>
> >>> W=
hat do I need besides the following?
> >>>
> >>> <bean class=3D"org.archive=
.modules.deciderules.surt.OnHostsDecideRule">
> >>>             <property n=
ame=3D"decision" value=3D"ACCEPT"/>

> >>
> >> OnHosts=
DecideRule is a specialization of SurtPrefixedDecideRule.
> >>
> >> Both th=
ese rules can build their internal list of configured prefixes
> >> (agains=
t which URIs are tested) from one or both of:
> >>
> >> (1) the crawl's con=
figured seeds -- if setting property
> >> seedsAsSurtPrefixes is true (whic=
h is the default)
> >>
> >> (2) a supplied file of URIs or prefixes, one to=
 a line, via the
> >> 'surtsSourceFile' setting property (a path to the fil=
e to use)
> >>
> >> In addition to the usual ways that desired prefixes are=
 deduced from
> >> URIs but SurtPrefixedDecideRule, for OnHostsDecideRule a=
ll prefixes are
> >> truncated to the host component.
> >>
> >> For example=
, SurtPrefixedDecideRule will turn the URI
> >> <http://example.com/images/=
>  into the implied SURT prefix
> >> <http://(com,example,)/images/>. OnHos=
tsDecideRule will further truncate
> >> that prefix to<http://(com,example,=
)/>, causing more URIs to be matched.
> >>
> >> Everything OnHostsDecideRul=
e can do, SurtPrefixedDecideRule can do, too
> >> -- if SurtPrefixedDecideR=
ule is supplied with URIs/prefixes already
> >> limited to the host-portion=
. For that reason, OnHostsDecideRule might be
> >> discouraged/deprecated/d=
eleted someday, so that there aren't redundant
> >> ways to achieve the sam=
e effect.
> >>
> >> - Gordon @ IA
